AZ1.Description: Availability Zone of the newly created EC2 instance

AZ2.Description: Availability Zone of the newly created EC2 instance

DomainName.Description: Domain name of the newly created stack instance

ELBv2TargetGroupHttp80.Description: TargetGroup for protocol HTTP on port 80

ELBv2TargetGroupHttp8001.Description: TargetGroup for protocol HTTP on port 8001

InstanceId1.Description: InstanceId of the newly created EC2 instance

InstanceId2.Description: InstanceId of the newly created EC2 instance

PrivateIP1.Description: Private IP address of the newly created EC2 instance

PrivateIP2.Description: Private IP address of the newly created EC2 instance

PublicIP1.Description: Public IP address of the newly created EC2 instance

PublicIP2.Description: Public IP address of the newly created EC2 instance

KeyName.Description: EC2 KeyPair that enables SSH access to this instance

UserData.Fn::Base64:
#!/bin/bash
set -x
exec > >(tee /var/log/user-data.log|logger -t user-data -s 2>/dev/console) 2>&1
echo  > /etc/build-vars.json.b64

if command -v salt-minion > /dev/null; then
    # salt is installed, probably using an AMI or creating an AMI
    # https://docs.saltstack.com/en/latest/ref/modules/all/salt.modules.saltutil.html#salt.modules.saltutil.clear_cache
    systemctl stop salt-minion 2> /dev/null || service salt-minion stop
fi

# remove leftover files from AMIs
rm -rf \
    /etc/cfn-info.json \
    /etc/salt/pki/minion/* \
    /etc/salt/minion \
    /root/.ssh/* \
    /home/elife/.ssh/* \
    /home/ubuntu/.ssh/id_rsa* \
    /etc/certificates/* \
    /root/events.log \
    /var/cache/salt/minion
